data.title: Encounter Brazil
data.text:
How to make friends, the World Cup way: Week 2 and beyond

So, there we have it. The World Cup party has drawn to a close and while I could spin out World Cup stuff over several more blog posts (largely because I’m not quite sure how to return to real life just yet) I won’t – or at least I’ll try not to. Instead, I’ll follow …

How to make friends, the World Cup way: Week 1

As I’ve mentioned in a recent World Cup-related post one of the best, unanticipated bonuses of being in Rio over the past few weeks has undoubtedly been the World Cup friendships which have formed. It can’t just be me and the people I happen to have been around, I’m quite sure this has been a common …

BRASIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIL !!! So much more than “just a game”

I was going to tell you about the array of new World Cup friends I’ve made in Rio over the past few weeks, but after the events of yesterday I’ll have to leave that one until next time. For those of you not particularly interested in football let’s be clear about something: this is not …

The World Cup party has well and truly started!

The World Cup party is in full swing, and for those who are missing out I’ve got to tell you: it’s bloody brilliant! As predicted in my last blog post, written on the eve of the World Cup, support for protesters, strikers and the anti-everything-Brazilian-brigade has made way for fun, enjoyment and mass excitement as …
